2.title: Changelog
2.content: All notable changes to SignalStack will be documented in this file.

3.content: Added . | Smart Event Routing: Dynamic routing based on payload. | Retry Engine: Configurable retry policies with exponential backoff. | Advanced Analytics: Real-time insights dashboard. | . Changed . | SDK: Complete rewrite of Node.js SDK (signalstack-v2). | API: Standardized response format for all endpoints. | . Deprecated . | v1 SDK: signalstack-v1 is now in maintenance mode. | Basic Triggers: Replaced by Smart Routing rules. | .

4.content: Added . | Webhook signature verification. | Improved error messages. | .

5.content: Initial Release . | Core Event Dispatching. | Basic Webhook Support. | .

6.title: New Features in v2.0
6.content: SignalStack v2.0 introduces powerful new capabilities to manage your event streams.

7.title: Smart Event Routing
7.content: Route events to specific endpoints based on payload content. Define routing rules in the dashboard or via API. | Example: Route priority: "high" events to a dedicated fast-lane webhook. | .

8.title: Retry Engine
8.content: Configure automatic retry policies for failed deliveries. | Exponential Backoff: Inteligently wait between retry attempts. | Dead Letter Queues: Capture events that fail after max retries for manual inspection. | .

9.title: Advanced Analytics
9.content: Real-time visibility into your event pipeline. | Delivery Success Rate: Track % of successful deliveries. | Latency Metrics: Monitor end-to-end delivery time. | .

10.title: Event Filtering
10.content: Filter events at the source before they are dispatched, saving bandwidth and processing power.

13.title: Event Dispatching
13.content: SignalStack v1.0 provides robust event dispatching capabilities. You can emit events from your application and have them delivered to configured endpoints. Supported Protocols . | HTTP/HTTPS Webhooks | .

14.title: Webhook Delivery
14.content: Webhooks are delivered via POST requests with a JSON payload. Payload Structure . { "event": "user.signup", "timestamp": "2023-10-27T10:00:00Z", "data": { "userId": "12345", "email": "user@example.com" } } .

15.title: Basic Triggers
15.content: Configure triggers in the dashboard to listen for specific event types and fire webhooks. Currently supports exact match on event names.

17.title: Getting Started with v2.0 (Latest)
17.content: Welcome to SignalStack v2.0! This guide will help you get up and running with the latest features.

18.title: Prerequisites
18.content: . | New Requirement: Node.js 18+ environment (v2 SDK requirement). | existing SignalStack account. | .

19.title: Installation
19.content: Install the new v2 SDK: . npm install signalstack-v2 .

20.title: Quick Start
20.content: Initialize the client with enhanced configuration options: . import { SignalStackClient } from 'signalstack-v2'; const client = new SignalStackClient({ apiKey: process.env.SIGNALSTACK_API_KEY, options: { retry: true, // Enable automatic retries timeout: 5000 // 5s timeout } }); await client.events.emit('order.created', { orderId: '98765', amount: 49.99 }); . See Migration Guide if upgrading from v1.

22.title: Getting Started with v1.0
22.content: Follow these steps to integrate SignalStack v1.0 into your application.

23.title: Prerequisites
23.content: . | Ensure you have an active SignalStack account. | Obtain your API Key from the dashboard. | .

24.title: Installation
24.content: Install the SignalStack client library: . npm install signalstack-v1 .

25.title: Basic Usage
25.content: Initialize the client and emit an event: . const SignalStack = require('signalstack-v1'); const client = new SignalStack('YOUR_API_KEY'); client.emit('user.signup', { userId: '12345', email: 'user@example.com' }); . This will trigger any webhooks configured for the user.signup event.

27.title: SignalStack v2.0 Documentation (Latest)
27.content: Welcome to the documentation for SignalStack v2.0. This major upgrade introduces advanced capabilities for smarter system behavior and improved performance.

28.title: What’s New in v2.0
28.content: . | Smart Event Routing: Dynamically route events based on payload content and metadata. | Retry Engine: Configurable retry policies with exponential backoff for failed deliveries. | Advanced Analytics: Real-time insights into event delivery success rates and latency. | Event Filtering: Granular control over which events trigger notifications. | .

29.title: Getting Started
29.content: Head over to the Getting Started guide to set up your integration with the powerful new features of SignalStack v2.0.

31.title: SignalStack v1.0 Documentation (Legacy)
31.content: Welcome to the documentation for SignalStack v1.0. This version is the foundation release focusing on core event dispatching and webhook delivery.

32.title: Key Features
32.content: . | Event Dispatching: Reliable delivery of events to your subscribed endpoints. | Webhooks: Simple HTTP callbacks for real-time notifications. | Basic Triggers: Define actions based on specific event types. | .

33.title: Getting Started
33.content: Check out the Getting Started guide to integrate SignalStack v1.0 into your application.

35.title: SignalStack Documentation
35.content: Welcome to the SignalStack developer hub. Build reliable, scalable notification infrastructure with our real-time event platform. Event Dispatching • Intelligent Routing • Real-time Webhooks Get Started with v2.0 (Latest) View Changelog .

36.title: Select Documentation Version
36.content: Version 2.0 (Latest) . Recommended for all new integrations. Features Smart Event Routing, Retry Engine, and advanced analytics. Explore v2.0 Version 1.0 (Legacy) . Maintenance mode. Covers basic Event Dispatching and Webhook Delivery. View v1.0

37.title: Resources
37.content: . | Migration Guide: Step-by-step guide to upgrade from v1.0 to v2.0. | Changelog: Track feature updates and breaking changes. | .

39.title: Migration Guide: v1.0 → v2.0
39.content: This guide will help you upgrade your integration from SignalStack v1.0 to v2.0.

40.title: Overview
40.content: Version 2.0 introduces a new SDK and improved API structure. While the core concepts remain the same, there are some breaking changes you need to be aware of.

41.title: Breaking Changes
41.content: SDK Import . The SDK package name has changed. v1.0 . const SignalStack = require('signalstack-v1'); . v2.0 . import { SignalStackClient } from 'signalstack-v2'; . Authentication . API Keys are now passed in a configuration object, not as a direct string argument. v1.0 . const client = new SignalStack('MY_KEY'); . v2.0 . const client = new SignalStackClient({ apiKey: 'MY_KEY' }); .

42.title: Deprecated Features
42.content: . | Basic Triggers: The “Triggers” tab in the dashboard has been replaced by “Routing Rules”. Your existing triggers have been automatically migrated to simple rules. | .

43.title: Step-by-Step Upgrade
43.content: . | Update your dependency to signalstack-v2. | Update your client initialization code. | Verify your event payloads match the v2 schema (mostly backward compatible). | Test your integration in the sandbox environment. | .
